DOC.brief_summary: This study conduct adult participant symptoms common cold assess 1146A nasal spray reduces severity symptom common cold compare placebo . The study also evaluate safety 1146A compare placebo .
DOC.brief_title: To Evaluate Efficacy Safety 1146A Nasal Spray Adult Participants With Symptoms Common Cold
DOC.detailed_description: This multi-center , randomize , parallel-group , double blind , 2-arm , placebo control study evaluate efficacy safety 1146A adult participant symptomatic common cold outpatient setting .
DOC.criteria: Demonstrates understand study procedure , restriction willingness participate evidenced voluntary write informed consent receive sign date copy inform consent form . Aged 18 75 year inclusive . Male female . Good general mental health , opinion Investigator medically qualify designee clinically significant relevant abnormality medical history upon physical Investigatorled nasal examination . Females childbearing potential , opinion Investigator , practice reliable method contraception . Adequate contraception define abstinence , oral contraceptive , either combined progestogen alone OR injectable progestogen OR implant levonorgestrel OR estrogenic vaginal ring OR percutaneous contraceptive patch OR intrauterine device intrauterine system OR double barrier method ( condom occlusive cap ( diaphragm cervical vault cap ) plus spermicidal agent ( foam , gel , film , cream , suppository ) ) OR male partner sterilization prior female participant 's entry study , male sole partner participant . Investigator confirm diagnosis symptomatic common cold onset le 48 hour prior randomization . Symptomatic common cold define TSS > 9 AND score > 1 least one follow symptom : sore throat , runny nose , block nose . Women positive urine pregnancy test . Women breastfeed . An inability comprehend satisfactorily use measurement instrument determine study site staff screen . J . Participants fever > 38°C ( 100.4°F ) . K. Frequent use analgesic ( i.e . take analgesic pain headache pain muscle/joints least 1 dose per week average past 6 month ) .
